prompt: Tell me a fun fact about llamas.
response: Llamas are not native to South America! Contrary to popular belief, llamas actually originated in North America around 35 million years ago. They migrated to South America during the formation of the isthmus of Panama approximately 3-4 million years ago. However, they were domesticated and became an integral part of Andean cultures much more recently, around 6000 years ago.
